com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface addContainerToManifest

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface addContainerToManifest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document addContainerToManifest(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The addContainerToManifest API adds a shipment or load container to an open manifest for a carrier.

    • Method Detail

      • addContainerToManifest

        org.w3c.dom.Document addContainerToManifest(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                            java.rmi.RemoteException

        The addContainerToManifest API adds a shipment or load container to an open manifest for a carrier. This API works off the pipeline. The addContainerToManifest API performs the following tasks:

        • Validates the input XML
        • Checks if the container is pack process complete, if not throws exception.
        • If the user does not pass manifest information in input, it checks for any open manifest for that carrier for that day. If any open manifest exists for that day then carton gets added to that manifest. If no open manifest exists then it checks whether AutoOpenManifest flag is 'Y' for that carrier. If it is 'Y', it calls openManifest API to open a new manifest.
        • Even if there is already a manifest open for that carrier, the next day a new manifest gets opened for that carrier. This is true if the user does not specify any manifest number while manifesting cartons. The user can always specify an open manifest's number to which the cartons can be added.
        • If the container is inside a parent container, call removeFromContainer API.
        • If LocationId is passed in the input and the container is not present at manifest location, call moveLocationInventory API.
        • If Scac Integration is required, it formulates input for YCS and sends it through socket connection.
        • Posts the values obtained from YCS on the container.
        • If this is the first container in shipment to be manifested, post ManifestKey and ManifestNo on shipment also.
        • Or if this is the first container in load to be manifested, post ManifestKey and ManifestNo on load and shipments belonging to the load.
        • If at commit time of addContainerToManifest, the manifest to which user is trying to add container is closed, then removeContainerFromManifestis called to do YCS side rollback.

        For shipment level integration service, this API does the following additional tasks:
        • Allows packages in the Shipment to be manifested only if Shipment is pack process complete. If Shipment belongs to a Load, then all the Shipments belonging to the Load must be pack process complete.
        • Prints labels when the last package of the Shipment is manifested.
        • Sets the Airway Bill # returned by the carrier server on the manifested Shipment/Load.

        For domestic shipments with package level integration service of carrier FedEx and UPS, the API can also generate return shipping label for the container and items packed inside the container.
        If the carrier selected for return integration is different from the carrier used for the shipping/manifest integration, then the Carrier Adaptor implementing both integrations will be considered to be same as that used for shipping/manifest integration by Sterling. So, return integration will be successful if return carrier service selected supports return integration and is configured to integrate for returns. Otherwise return labels or return tracking numbers will not be generated. Although for shipments of carrier FedEx, say one selects UPS as the return carrier. If the return carrier service selected supports returns, and integration of UPS using Sterling Pierbridge Adaptor is configured correctly, return integration will be successful and return labels, return tracking numbers will be generated.
        For determining freight terms for returns integration, the API first checks if the return freight terms is set on the shipment. If not, it checks if the Third Party Billing details are configured for return shipment in the Parcel Carrier Preferences in Sterling WMS. In this case, the return freight terms is set as TPB (Third Party Billing) on the shipment. If not, it checks if the Third Party Billing details are configured for outbound shipment in the Parcel Carrier Preferences in Sterling WMS. In this case, the return freight terms is set as TPB on the shipment. If not, the return freight terms is set as PRE (Prepaid) on the shipment. If any error is encountered during integration with carrier server during return label transaction, the container is removed from the manifest. The user should not use any of the labels which may have got generated during the process. Note: Manifest date field if passed will be considered else default manifest date will be the current system date.
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        The following user exit is called before calling YCS:
        com.yantra.ydm.integration.ycs.japi.ue.YCSBeforeShipCartonUE.
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMCanShipmentBeProcessedUE.
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMBeforeAddContainerToManifestUE.
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPDetermineTaskTypeUE.

        The following user exit is called from YCS:
        com.yantra.ycs.japi.ue.YCSshipCartonUserExit

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction ADD_TO_MANIFEST.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of addContainerToManifest.
            Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_MANIFEST.ON_SUCCESS.xml

          ON_SHIPMENT_MANIFEST_COMPLETE:
            This event is raised when the entire shipment is manfested.
            Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_MANIFEST.ON_SHIPMENT_MANIFEST_COMPLETE.xml

          ON_LOAD_MANIFEST_COMPLETE:
            This event is raised when all the containers in the load and its shipments are manifested.
            Data published - YDM_ADD_TO_MANIFEST.ON_LOAD_MANIFEST_COMPLETE.xml

        Pierbrdige Label URL Support in API Output: Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: None

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: Yes
        Versions: ver32, ver40 and ver45.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the container that was manifested. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
